newsitem.title: MEXICO: First-ever Black Film Awards announced in Acapulco.
newsitem.headline: First-ever Black Film Awards announced in Acapulco.

text.p: The winners of the first annual Black Film Awards were announced on Saturday, with "Once Upon a Time When We Were Coloured" getting the best film award.
Queen Latifah won best actress for her part in "Set it Off." F. Gary Gray won best director for "Set it Off," and the film also took the honour for best soundtrack.
Ossie Davis won best actor for his role in "Get On The Bus."
The organisers of the Black Film Festival -- this year held in Acapulco -- were the Black Filmmaker Foundation and UniWorld Group, Inc., both based in New York.

Winners were chosen by ballots submitted by festival attendees. For each category, five nominees were selected from a list of 10 films that were either directed by or written and produced by African Americans and released in 1996.
